Class GridRenderer

java.lang.Object
utils.GridRenderer
public class GridRenderer extends Object
Static utility class for rendering the game grid to terminal. Uses simple character-based representation. Week 10: Grid dimensions inferred from grid array passed in (dynamic sizing) This eliminates hard-coded constants - grid size comes from DungeonMap Week 11: Added double buffering to reduce flickering

  • Method Details

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Clears the terminal screen using ANSI escape codes. This moves cursor to home and clears the entire screen. Only used for initial setup.

    • moveCursor

      public static void moveCursor(int x, int y)
      Moves cursor to specific grid position using ANSI escape codes.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate (0-based)
      y - Y coordinate (0-based)

    • beginFrame

      public static void beginFrame()
      Week 11: Starts buffering mode - all draw calls are accumulated

    • endFrame

      public static void endFrame()
      Week 11-01: Flushes buffer to screen and positions cursor safely This implements our input echo mitigation strategy: 1. Hide cursor with ANSI escape code \033[?25l 2. Position cursor at row 27, col 1 (below the 25-row map) 3. Windows console echoes input at cursor position, so this ensures echo appears below visible game area 4. Combined with 3x3 player area redraw (GameEngine.java), this fully solves the input echo problem

    • clearCell

      public static void clearCell(int x, int y)
      Clears a specific cell by drawing empty cell character.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate

    • drawCell

      public static void drawCell(char symbol, int x, int y)
      Draws a character at specific cell position.
      Parameters:
      symbol - Character to draw
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate

    • moveCursorBelowGrid

      public static void moveCursorBelowGrid(int offsetY)
      Moves cursor to position after the grid for drawing HUD.
      Parameters:
      offsetY - How many lines below the grid

    • drawText

      public static void drawText(String text, int x, int y)
      Week 11: Append text to buffer at specific position Used by HUD to integrate with buffering system

    • drawNotification

      public static void drawNotification(String notification, int row)
      Week 11: Draw notification at fixed position (integrated with buffering) Clears the line first, then writes the notification
      Parameters:
      notification - Message to display
      row - Row position for notification

    • drawGrid

      public static void drawGrid(char[][] grid)
      Draws the entire grid with entities at their positions.
      Parameters:
      entities - Array of entity characters and their positions

    • createEmptyGrid

      public static char[][] createEmptyGrid()
      Creates an empty grid filled with EMPTY_CELL character.
      Returns:
      2D char array representing empty grid

    • drawEntity

      public static void drawEntity(char[][] grid, char symbol, int x, int y)
      Places an entity symbol on the grid at specified position.
      Parameters:
      grid - The grid to modify
      symbol - The character representing the entity
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate
